After pooling data from 6 studies, the authors concluded that catheter ablation was superior to drug therapy in reducing mortality (risk ratio, 0.52 [95% CI, 0.33 to 0.81]; I2 = 0%) and HF hospitalizations (risk ratio, 0.60 [CI, 0.39 to 0.93]; I2 = 0%).In their assessment of the quality of the evidence, the authors evaluated specific domains in individual studies using the Cochrane risk-of-bias framework and classified these elements as having high, moderate, or low ...References1.
